sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>slide</radical> coming out of the patient's <radical>heart</radical> is there because a mad scientist is testing to see if it's a good way to drain the body of blood. The patient is alive now... but they are definitely slated for <kanji>certain</kanji> death.
meaningInfo: As you imagine the mad scientist drawing blood out of the patient's heart with a small slide, also imagine a little meter hooked up to him as well. On one end is "SURVIVE!" on the other end is "CERTAIN DEATH." Right now the finger is pointing close to <kanji>certain</kanji> death, though :(
readingMnemonic: As the beeping heart thing starts to do one long continuous beeeeeeeeeeeeeep, the doctor puts his hands together and <reading>hits</reading> (<ja>ひつ</ja>) the dead patient over and over, attempting to bring him back.
readingInfo: Maybe imagine yourself running in there too, just trying to <reading>hit</reading> the patient back to life, because the patient was your friend.
